args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor Chapter 12 of the main campaign and for\nthe Forgotten Truths event.
Sir, our troops have finished supplying\nfood and water to the villages of Alberia.
Further, plans proceed apace on the\nreparations for lost homes and fields.
We've also secured funding sources\nfor the solatia due the people.\nAll that remains now is distribution.
And how do our defenses fare?

Reinforcement proceeds without issue,
Your Highness. As instructed, we have
deployed troops to key locations.
All are prepared to mobilize.
Your Highness, please pardon the\nintrusion. It is time for the public hearing.
You can say that again. He used to be\ntotally heedless of other people.
Praise be to him for courting the\nopinions of the people firsthand.\nTruly, I am grateful.
Indeed. I was uneasy at first; to him,\npower was first and last in all matters\nback when he governed Valkaheim.
What circumstances could have brought on\nhis sudden change, I wonder.
Hm... Why DID he change so suddenly?
You mean Leonidas? Yeah, he's\nbecome a pretty stand-up guy lately.\nTalk about a heel turn.
Guy prolly got tired of gettin' his butt\nhanded to him in his feud with\n{player_name}.
He was so cold-blooded before, it\nwoulda given a lizard a run for its\nrupies. Guess he grew a heart.
If I'm not mistaken, his goal was a world\nunfettered by the yoke of dragons.
Correct. Could he have abandoned that\ncause?
Goodness. Do you think my dear brother\nLeonidas is so mercurial a man?
I mean, he changed his tune faster than\na conductor with a caffeine buzz. Are you\nsaying there's something more to it?
Not at all. In fact, I would assert that he\nis the same man you've always known.
No way, lady. It's night and day. He's\nacting like an actual good ruler now.
It is unwise to judge a person's character\nby the mask they wear on the surface.
My brother believes that might makes\nright, and he would do anything to uphold\nthat view. That's who he really is.
In other words, what has changed are\nhis means—not the ideals at his core.
So you think that becoming a nice guy\nis part of some strategy he cooked up\nto make his freaky dreams come true?
Meaning that his aim is, as ever,\nto dismantle the dragons' hegemony\nover our world?
He had some pretty serious beef with\n{player_name}. You sayin' that\nhostility is still there?
Oh, c'mon, give us a straight answer!
I am not the master of my brother's\nthoughts. He is difficult to understand—\na man with profound depth.

But what I can say is this: without him,
we would be unable to depart southern
Grastaea and travel north as we have
been.
Rather than casting the eye of suspicion\nupon him, oughn't we be grateful instead?
But even if his goal hasn't changed, it's\nstill a mystery as to WHY he switched up\nhis methods.
Do we have any other clues, aside from\nhow he lost to {player_name}?
Nothing springs to mind.\nChelle, any ideas?
I have nothing, I'm afraid. But I do believe\nhe was spurred on by a catalyst of sorts.
I suspect that the world may be shifting\nin ways and places unknown to us.
Leonidas, why did you make that move?
If I divulged that, the move itself would\nlose its value.
Ha ha. It's clear you're after something.\nI just struggle to see what that\nall-important something may be.
Now that I think of it...are you aware that\nsimilar sentiment has been echoing\nthrough the streets of late?
They say His Majesty Prince Leonidas has\nsuddenly changed. The people are all\nguessing at what you might be thinking.
They know that the great first scion of\nAlberia must have something in the back\nof his mind that drives him forward.
But there are none who know the truth of\nit. None besides the two of us, of course.
I swear, if eyes were daggers, yours\nwould've cut me to shreds by now.\n...I'm just saying I'm happy, that's all.
Happy that you accepted us and our\nsudden appearance.
And that you believed my tale.
Anyway, that's enough of that.\nIt's time to attack.
Don't you think you're being reckless?
I won't know 'til I try. Even a stray\nshot can blast open a locked door.\nYou just have to be ready to step through.
I mean, think back to that fateful night.
My recklessness got me exactly where\nI needed to be: rubbing elbows with you.
